TITLE: Configuring Customer Service Agent with RAG Integration in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Complete configuration file for setting up a customer service agent. Includes role definition, objectives, domain specifications, document sources for RAG, and worker definitions for handling customer inquiries and information retrieval.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/tutorials/customer-service.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "role": "customer service assistant",
    "user_objective": "The customer service assistant helps users with customer service inquiries. It can provide information about products, services, and policies, as well as help users resolve issues and complete transactions.",
    "builder_objective": "The customer service assistant helps to request customer's contact information.",
    "domain": "robotics and automation",
    "intro": "Richtech Robotics's headquarter is in Las Vegas; the other office is in Austin. Richtech Robotics provide worker robots (ADAM, ARM, ACE), delivery robots (Matradee, Matradee X, Matradee L, Richie), cleaning robots (DUST-E SX, DUST-E MX) and multipurpose robots (skylark). Their products are intended for business purposes, but not for home purpose; the ADAM robot is available for purchase and rental for multiple purposes. This robot bartender makes tea, coffee and cocktails. Richtech Robotics also operate the world's first robot milk tea shop, ClouTea, in Las Vegas (www.cloutea.com), where all milk tea beverages are prepared by the ADAM robot. The delivery time will be one month for the delivery robot, 2 weeks for standard ADAM, and two months for commercial cleaning robot. ",
    "task_docs": [{
        "source": "https://www.richtechrobotics.com/",
        "num": 20
    }],
    "rag_docs": [{
        "source": "https://www.richtechrobotics.com/",
        "num": 20
    }],
    "tasks": [],
    "workers": [
        {"id": "9aa47724-0b77-4752-9528-cf4b06a46915", "name": "FaissRAGWorker", "path": "faiss_rag_worker.py"},
        {"id": "26bb6634-3bee-417d-ad75-23269ac17bc3", "name": "MessageWorker", "path": "message_worker.py"},
        {"id": "9c15af81-04b3-443e-be04-a3522124b905", "name": "SearchWorker", "path": "search_worker.py"},
        {"id": "b06c2b58-12c5-41fe-9838-e93b530e42e8", "name": "DefaultWorker", "path": "default_worker.py"}
    ],
    "tools": []
}
```

TITLE: Implementing MessageState Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: Defines the MessageState class as a TypedDict with various attributes representing system configuration, input messages, message flow, response, and task-related parameters. This class is crucial for maintaining the state of a conversation in an agent-based system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/MessageState.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class MessageState(TypedDict):
    # system configuration
    sys_instruct: str
    # input message
    user_message: ConvoMessage
    orchestrator_message: OrchestratorMessage
    # message flow between different nodes
    message_flow: Annotated[str, "message flow between different nodes"]
    # final response
    response: str
    # task-related params
    status: StatusEnum
    slots: list[Slot]
```

TITLE: Choosing Worker Method in DefaultWorker
DESCRIPTION: Implements the _choose_worker method to select an appropriate worker based on the user's message and task. It uses a language model to make the selection, with a fallback to a base choice.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/DefaultWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def _choose_worker(self, state: MessageState, limit=2):
        user_message = state['user_message']
        task = state["orchestrator_message"].attribute.get("task", "")
        workers_info = "\n".join([f"{name}: {description}" for name, description in self.available_workers.items()])
        workers_name = ", ".join(self.available_workers.keys())

        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(choose_worker_prompt)
        input_prompt = prompt.invoke({"message": user_message.message, "formatted_chat": user_message.history, "task": task, "workers_info": workers_info, "workers_name": workers_name})
        chunked_prompt = chunk_string(input_prompt.text, tokenizer=MODEL["tokenizer"], max_length=MODEL["context"])
        final_chain = self.llm | StrOutputParser()
        while limit > 0:
            answer = final_chain.invoke(chunked_prompt)
            for worker_name in self.available_workers.keys():
                if worker_name in answer:
                    logger.info(f"Chosen worker for the default worker: {worker_name}")
                    return worker_name
            limit -= 1
        logger.info(f"Base worker chosen for the default worker: {self.base_choice}")
        return self.base_choice
```

TITLE: Executing DefaultWorker in Python
DESCRIPTION: Implements the execute method for DefaultWorker. It chooses a worker using the _choose_worker method and then executes the chosen worker with the given message state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/DefaultWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def execute(self, msg_state: MessageState):
        chose_worker = self._choose_worker(msg_state)
        worker = WORKER_REGISTRY[chose_worker]()
        result = worker.execute(msg_state)
        return result
```

TITLE: Implementing the Generator Function for Message Response
DESCRIPTION: The complete generator function that processes MessageState, handles direct responses, generates messages with context, and updates the state with the response. It supports both building on existing message flow or creating new responses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/MessageWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def generator(self, state: MessageState) -> MessageState:
    # get the input message
    user_message = state['user_message']
    orchestrator_message = state['orchestrator_message']
    message_flow = state.get('response', "") + "\n" + state.get("message_flow", "")

    # get the orchestrator message content
    orch_msg_content = orchestrator_message.message
    orch_msg_attr = orchestrator_message.attribute
    direct_response = orch_msg_attr.get('direct_response', False)
    if direct_response:
        return orch_msg_content
    
    if message_flow and message_flow != "\n":
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(message_flow_generator_prompt)
        input_prompt = prompt.invoke({
            "sys_instruct": state["sys_instruct"], 
            "message": orch_msg_content, 
            "formatted_chat": user_message.history, 
            "initial_response": message_flow
        })
    else:
        prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(message_generator_prompt)
        input_prompt = prompt.invoke({
            "sys_instruct": state["sys_instruct"], 
            "message": orch_msg_content, 
            "formatted_chat": user_message.history
        })
    logger.info(f"Prompt: {input_prompt.text}")
    chunked_prompt = chunk_string(input_prompt.text, tokenizer=MODEL["tokenizer"], max_length=MODEL["context"])
    final_chain = self.llm | StrOutputParser()
    answer = final_chain.invoke(chunked_prompt)

    state["message_flow"] = ""
    state["response"] = answer
    return state
```

TITLE: Initializing DefaultWorker Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: Defines the DefaultWorker class, inheriting from BaseWorker. It initializes with a language model, sets a base choice worker, and populates available workers from environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/DefaultWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class DefaultWorker(BaseWorker):

    description = "Default worker decided by chat records if there is no specific worker for the user's query"

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.llm = ChatOpenAI(model=MODEL["model_type_or_path"], timeout=30000)
        self.base_choice = "MessageWorker"
        available_workers = os.getenv("AVAILABLE_WORKERS", "").split(",")
        self.available_workers = {name: WORKER_REGISTRY[name].description for name in available_workers if name != "DefaultWorker"}
```

TITLE: Implementing RAGWorker Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: The complete RAGWorker class implementation, including the class attributes, initialization, action graph creation, and execution method. This class handles the retrieval and generation process for RAG-based responses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/RAGWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class RAGWorker(BaseWorker):

    description = "Answer the user's questions based on the company's internal documentations (unstructured text data), such as the policies, FAQs, and product information"

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.action_graph = self._create_action_graph()
        self.llm = ChatOpenAI(model=MODEL["model_type_or_path"], timeout=30000)
     
    def _create_action_graph(self):
        workflow = StateGraph(MessageState)
        # Add nodes for each worker
        workflow.add_node("retriever", RetrieveEngine.retrieve)
        workflow.add_node("tool_generator", ToolGenerator.context_generate)
        # Add edges
        workflow.add_edge(START, "retriever")
        workflow.add_edge("retriever", "tool_generator")
        return workflow

    def execute(self, msg_state: MessageState):
        graph = self.action_graph.compile()
        result = graph.invoke(msg_state)
        return result
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Slot(BaseModel):
    name: str
    type: str
    value: str
    description: str
    prompt: str
```

TITLE: Tool Registration Decorator Implementation in Python
DESCRIPTION: Complete example of registering a tool with the register_tool decorator, including parameter slots and output definitions for cart management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Tools.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
@register_tool(
    "Add items to cart",
    [
        {
            "name": "cart_id",
            "type": "str",
            "description": "Cart ID to add items to, such as '2938501948327'",
            "prompt": "",
            "required": True,
            "verified": True
        },
        {
            "name": "item_ids",
            "type": "list",
            "items": "tuples"
            "description": "list of (item_id, quantity) tuples of Items to add to the cart such as [('41552094527601', 5), ('41552094494833', 10)].",
            "prompt": "",
            "required": True,
            "verified": True
        }
    ],
    [{
        "name": "cart",
        "type": "dict",
        "description": "The cart information after adding, such as {'id': 'sample_cart', 'items': {'41552094527601': 5, '41552094494833': 10}}.",
    }],
    lambda x: x is not None and x not in ERROR_MSGS
)
```

TITLE: Converting Existing Method to Tool in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to convert an existing calculation method into a tool using the register_tool decorator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Tools.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from ast import eval as calculate

register_tool(
    "Calculates and return the function output of mathematical query.",
    [{
        "name": "expression",
        "type": "string",
        "description": "valid math expression extracted from the user message expressed with only numerical digits and these special characters ['(', ')', '+', '-', '*', '/', '%', '^'], like '21 * 2'",
        "prompt": "Could you please provide the mathematical expression?",
        "required": True
    }],
    [{
        "name": "result",
        "type": "float",
        "value": "",
        "description": "result of evaluated mathematical expression like 42",
    }],
    lambda x: isinstance(x, (int, float, complex)) and not isinstance(x, bool)
)(
    calculate
)
```

TITLE: Custom Calculator Tool Implementation in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example of implementing a custom calculator tool that evaluates mathematical expressions using the register_tool decorator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Tools.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import ast

@register_tool(
    "Calculates and return the function output of mathematical query.",
    [{
        "name": "expression",
        "type": "string",
        "description": "valid math expression extracted from the user message expressed with only numerical digits and these special characters ['(', ')', '+', '-', '*', '/', '%', '^'], like '21 * 2'",
        "prompt": "Could you please provide the mathematical expression?",
        "required": True
    }],
    [{
        "name": "result",
        "type": "float",
        "value": "",
        "description": "result of evaluated mathematical expression like 42",
    }],
    lambda x: isinstance(x, (int, float, complex)) and not isinstance(x, bool)
)
def calculator(expression):
    py_expression = expression.replace("^", "**")
    return ast.eval(py_expression)
```

TITLE: Initializing MessageWorker Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: The constructor and action graph creation method for the MessageWorker class. Sets up the LLM model and creates a StateGraph with the generator node.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/MessageWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def __init__(self):
    super().__init__()
    self.llm = ChatOpenAI(model=MODEL["model_type_or_path"], timeout=30000)
    self.action_graph = self._create_action_graph()

def _create_action_graph(self):
        workflow = StateGraph(MessageState)
        # Add nodes for each worker
        workflow.add_node("generator", self.generator)
        # Add edges
        workflow.add_edge(START, "generator")
        return workflow
```

TITLE: Initializing RAGWorker and Creating Action Graph in Python
DESCRIPTION: The __init__ and _create_action_graph methods of the RAGWorker class. These methods set up the LLM model and create a StateGraph with nodes and edges for the retrieval and generation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/RAGWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.action_graph = self._create_action_graph()
        self.llm = ChatOpenAI(model=MODEL["model_type_or_path"], timeout=30000)
     
def _create_action_graph(self):
    workflow = StateGraph(MessageState)
    # Add nodes for each worker
    workflow.add_node("retriever", RetrieveEngine.retrieve)
    workflow.add_node("tool_generator", ToolGenerator.context_generate)
    # Add edges
    workflow.add_edge(START, "retriever")
    workflow.add_edge("retriever", "tool_generator")
    return workflow
```

TITLE: Initializing SearchWorker in Python
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing the initialization of SearchWorker, including the constructor and the creation of the action graph with nodes and edges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/SearchWorker.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.action_graph = self._create_action_graph()
        self.llm = ChatOpenAI(model=MODEL["model_type_or_path"], timeout=30000)

def _create_action_graph(self):
    workflow = StateGraph(MessageState)
    # Add nodes for each worker
    search_engine = SearchEngine()
    workflow.add_node("search_engine", search_engine.search)
    workflow.add_node("tool_generator", ToolGenerator.context_generate)
    # Add edges
    workflow.add_edge(START, "search_engine")
    workflow.add_edge("search_engine", "tool_generator")
    return workflow
```

TITLE: Example Worker Execution Implementation in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of the execute method showing how to invoke a LangChain StateGraph with a MessageState input and return the processed result.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/Workers.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def execute(self, msg_state: MessageState):
    graph = self.action_graph.compile()
    result = graph.invoke(msg_state)
    return result
```

TITLE: Validating Meeting Time Slots in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet parses and validates the meeting time against unavailable time slots. It converts input times to timestamps and checks for conflicts with existing appointments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Integration/Hubspot.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
    meeting_date = parse_natural_date(meeting_date, timezone=time_zone, date_input=True)
    meeting_start_time = parse_natural_date(meeting_start_time, meeting_date, timezone=time_zone)
    meeting_start_time = int(meeting_start_time.timestamp() * 1000)


    duration = int(duration)
    duration = int(timedelta(minutes=duration).total_seconds() * 1000)

    meeting_end_time = meeting_start_time + duration

    bt_slots_ux = json.loads(bt_slots_ux)
    for time_slot in bt_slots_ux:
        if meeting_start_time >= time_slot['start'] and meeting_start_time < time_slot['end']:
            return UNAVAILABLE_ERROR
        elif meeting_end_time >= time_slot['start'] and meeting_end_time <= time_slot['end']:
            return UNAVAILABLE_ERROR
```

TITLE: Database Schema SQL Tables Definition
DESCRIPTION: SQL schema definitions for three core tables (show, user, booking) that form the show booking database structure. Includes column specifications, data types, and relationships.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/DatabaseWorker.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE show (
  id VARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY,
  show_name VARCHAR(100),
  genre VARCHAR(40),
  date DATE,
  time TIME,
  description TEXT,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  price DECIMAL,
  available_seats INTEGER
);

CREATE TABLE user (
  id VARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY,
  first_name VARCHAR(40),
  last_name VARCHAR(40),
  email VARCHAR(60),
  register_at TIMESTAMP,
  last_login TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE booking (
  id VARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY,
  show_id VARCHAR(40) REFERENCES show(id),
  user_id VARCHAR(40) REFERENCES user(id),
  created_at TIMESTAMP
);
```

TITLE: Implementing BaseWorker Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: Abstract base class for all Workers that defines the fundamental structure with a description attribute and execute method. Workers process MessageState inputs and return StateGraph outputs using LangChain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Workers/Workers.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class BaseWorker(ABC):
    
    description = None

    def __str__(self):
        return f"{self.__class__.__name__}"

    def __repr__(self):
        return f"{self.__class__.__name__}"
    
    @abstractmethod
    def execute(self, msg_state: MessageState):
        pass
```

TITLE: Creating Translation Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to create the necessary directory structure for French translations and copy the source file for translation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Example/tutorial-extras/translate-your-site.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir -p i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/

cp docs/intro.md i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring i18n Settings in Docusaurus
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Docusaurus i18n settings to support English and French locales by modifying the docusaurus.config.js file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Example/tutorial-extras/translate-your-site.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
export default {
  i18n: {
    defaultLocale: 'en',
    locales: ['en', 'fr'],
  },
};
```

TITLE: Starting Docusaurus Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the project directory and start the local development server. The server runs at http://localhost:3000/ and supports hot reloading for changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Example/intro.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd my-website
npm run start
```

TITLE: Importing DocCardList Component in React/JSX
DESCRIPTION: Imports the DocCardList component from the theme system and renders it within a documentation page layout with a markdown header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/docs/Integration/intro.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import DocCardList from '@theme/DocCardList';

# Integration

<DocCardList />
```

TITLE: Installing Docusaurus Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the docs directory and install required Docusaurus dependencies

TITLE: Creating Interactive Button with React in MDX
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create an interactive button using React JSX within an MDX blog post. It uses an inline onClick event handler to display an alert when clicked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/blog/2021-08-01-mdx-blog-post.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>
```

TITLE: Blog Post Truncation Comment
DESCRIPTION: HTML comment used to specify where the blog post preview should be truncated in list views
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/blog/2019-05-29-long-blog-post.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- truncate -->
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Truncation Point in Docusaurus Blog Post
DESCRIPTION: Inserts the truncate comment directive in a Docusaurus blog post. This HTML comment marks where the post should be cut off in list views, with the content before it serving as the post excerpt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/blog/2019-05-28-first-blog-post.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- truncate -->
```

TITLE: Configuring Docusaurus Blog Post Frontmatter in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Defines the metadata for a Docusaurus blog post using YAML frontmatter. It specifies the slug, title, authors array, and tags array that Docusaurus uses to generate the blog post page and related navigation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/blog/2019-05-28-first-blog-post.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
slug: first-blog-post
title: First Blog Post
authors: [slorber, yangshun]
tags: [hola, docusaurus]
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Markdown Page Front Matter
DESCRIPTION: Basic markdown front matter structure defining the page title using YAML syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/arklexai/agent-first-organization/blob/main/docs/src/pages/markdown-page.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
---
title: Markdown page example
---
```
